prompt:
A 1.50 kg block starts from rest at the top of a frictionless ramp of height 2.40 m and then slides onto a horizontal surface with kinetic friction coefficient Î¼k = 0.25.

1) What is the speed of the block at the bottom of the ramp?
2) How far does it slide on the horizontal surface before coming to rest?

Give the final numerical answers with correct units.

payload.text:
1) \( v = \sqrt{2gh} = \sqrt{2 \times 9.8 \, \text{m/s}^2 \times 2.40 \, \text{m}} = 6.77 \, \text{m/s} \)

2) The force of kinetic friction is \( F_{\text{friction}} = \mu_k mg = 0.25 \times 1.50 \, \text{kg} \times 9.8 \, \text{m/s}^2 = 3.675 \, \text{N} \).

The acceleration due to friction is \( a = \frac{F_{\text{friction}}}{m} = \frac{3.675 \, \text{N}}{1.50 \, \text{kg}} = 2.45 \, \text{m/s}^2 \).

The distance to stop is \( d = \frac{v^2}{2a} = \frac{(6.77 \, \text{m/s})^2}{2 \times 2.45 \, \text{m/s}^2} = 8.91 \, \text{m} \).

Final answer: \( v = 6.77 \, \text{m/s}, \, d = 8.91 \, \text{m} \)
